questions.question_text: Which data storage type is supported by Prisma Cloud Data Security?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B

The Data Security capabilities on Prisma Cloud enable you to discover and classify data stored in AWS S3 buckets and Azure Blob storage and protect accidental exposure, misuse, or sharing of sensitive data.

questions.question_text: Which action must be taken to enable a user to interact programmatically with the Prisma Cloud APIs and for a nonhuman entity to be enabled for the access keys?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Tricky question. The questions says: "enable a user ... AND for a nonhuman entity"
So, we should create a User and an Access Key, but the answer doesn't exist.

For exclusion, D.

Enable access to the Prisma Cloud APIs for non-human entities.
Service Accounts can be created for automation use cases to enable a nonhuman entity to interact programmatically with the Prisma Cloud APIs.

choices.C: Create a role with Account Group Read Only and assign it to the user.
choices.D: Create a role and assign it to the Service Account.
choices.B: Create a user with a role that has minimal access.
choices.A: Create a role with System Admin and generate access keys.

questions.question_text: Which three types of runtime rules can be created? (Choose three.)

comments.content:
Prisma Cloud Compute has distinct sensors for file system, network, and process activity. Ea
sensor is implemented individually, with its own set of rules and alerts.
A,B y C

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Prisma Cloud Compute has distinct sensors for file system, network, and process activity. Each sensor is implemented individually, with its own set of rules and alerts.

Selected Answer: ABC
ABC

There are four types of rules, but only three are relevant to runtime:
Processes
Networking-outgoing
File system

Selected Answer: A
A.

Saved Searches has list of search queries saved by any Prisma Cloud administrator.

choices.D: All users with whom the saved search has been shared
choices.B: Users who can access the tenant

questions.question_text: Who can access saved searches in a cloud account?

The Compute Console has recently been upgraded, and the administrator plans to delay upgrading the Defenders and the Twistcli tool until some of the teamâ€™s resources have been rescaled. The Console is currently one major release ahead.

What will happen as a result of the Console upgrade?

choices.A: Defenders will disconnect, and Twistcli will stop working.
choices.D: Defenders will remain connected, and Twistcli will stop working.
choices.B: Defenders will disconnect, and Twistcli will remain working.
choices.C: Both Defenders and Twistcli will remain working.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The answer is C.

C
-older versions of Defenders, Jenkins plugins, and twistcli can interoperate with newer versions of Console. 
( https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/22-06/prisma-cloud-compute-edition-admin/upgrade/support_lifecycle )

Selected Answer: C
C

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/22-06/prisma-cloud-compute-edition-admin/upgrade/upgrade_process_self_hosted
Prisma Cloud console is backward compatible up to two major releases back (including all minor versions) with the following:
All types of Defenders.
Twistcli/Jenkins plugin.

comments.content:
C answer according to this link.

"Prisma Cloud console is backward compatible up to two major releases back (including all minor versions) with the following:
- All types of Defenders.
- Twistcli/Jenkins plugin."
